title: Fed Lifts Rates by 0.75 Point, Largest Increase Since 1994
type: The Federal Reserve signaled it will continue tightening policy this year at the most rapid pace in decades as it races to combat inflation. It expects the federal-funds target rate to end the year at 3.4%, up from past projections. Chairman Jerome Powell said an 0.75-point rate hike could also be on the table in July.

title: Stocks Rally After Fed Decision
type: U.S. stocks jumped as the Fed raised interest rates by 0.75 percentage point but suggested moves of that scale wouldn’t become common.3 min read

title: Economics Has Some Explaining to Do About Inflation
type: Economic models that worked for decades broke down during the pandemic, and alternatives have yet to emerge.3125 min read

title: Investors See Higher Defaults Ahead as Interest Rates, Inflation Take a Toll
type: Debt investors are betting that the Federal Reserve’s latest rate hike is a prelude to a downturn for some U.S. companies as rising borrowing costs are likely to put a damper on consumer spending and raise expenses for business.3 min read

title: Retail Sales Fall as Inflation Stings Consumers
type: Americans’ spending at stores, online and in restaurants declined 0.3% in May as consumers felt the pinch from inflation, higher gasoline prices and rising interest rates.3065 min read
